decomposition: Open the tofu packages.
Drain off excess liquid from the tofu packages.

instructions.original_text: You can dry out the tofu by blotting it in a napkin just to get all the water that you can out.
decomposition: Wrap or blot tofu pieces with paper towels or a napkin.
Press or blot to absorb as much water as possible.

instructions.original_text: Cube the tofu and lay on an oven safe tray.
decomposition: Cut the tofu into cubes.
Arrange the tofu cubes in a single layer on an oven-safe tray.

instructions.original_text: Turn on the broil setting on your oven to high.
decomposition: Set the oven to the broil setting on high.

instructions.original_text: Broil the tofu until it is dry and lightly toasted, about 20 mins.
decomposition: Place the tray of tofu under the broiler.
Broil and monitor tofu until it is dry and lightly toasted, about 20.0 minutes total (turn frequently for even browning).

instructions.original_text: Make sure you keep turning it so that it is evenly browned.
decomposition: Use tongs or a spatula to turn tofu pieces periodically while broiling.
Ensure pieces brown evenly on all sides.

instructions.original_text: Using your measuring cup, measure 1 1/2 cup of ketchup and pour into a bowl.
decomposition: Measure 1.5 cup of ketchup with a measuring cup.
Pour the measured ketchup into a mixing bowl.

instructions.original_text: Next measure 1/2 cup of molasses and add to the ketchup.
decomposition: Measure 0.5 cup of molasses.
Add the molasses to the bowl with ketchup.

instructions.original_text: Now, squeeze your lemon and you should get 1/4 cup of juice.
decomposition: Roll and cut lemon(s) as needed.
Squeeze lemon(s) to obtain 0.25 cup of lemon juice.
Stir the ketchup, molasses, and lemon juice together until combined.

instructions.original_text: Now pour that mixture into your pot and cook for about 2 mins on med heat.
decomposition: Pour the combined sauce mixture into a pot.
Heat the pot over medium heat.
Cook the sauce for about 2.0 minutes while stirring occasionally.

instructions.original_text: Add your salt and sugar to taste (I added mine before I cooked it but it seems to dissolve better if you put in when the sauce is warm).
decomposition: Measure and add salt to the sauce to taste.
Measure and add sugar to the sauce to taste.
Stir until salt and sugar dissolve in the warm sauce.

instructions.original_text: When tofu is finished, you can either put the tofu in the pot and mix or you can pour the sauce over the tofu.
decomposition: Decide whether to combine tofu and sauce in the pot or to pour sauce over tofu on the tray.
If combining in the pot, transfer broiled tofu to the pot with sauce.
If pouring, arrange tofu in a bowl or tray and pour hot sauce evenly over the tofu pieces.

instructions.original_text: Mix well, making sure that the tofu is entirely covered.
decomposition: Toss or stir tofu and sauce together until all tofu pieces are well coated.

instructions.original_text: If you want to do the flower: take a sweet pepper and cut petals without cutting all the way through; bend the petals out and down to expose the center.
decomposition: Wash a sweet pepper.
Hold the pepper upside down (stem down).
Use a paring knife to cut petal shapes into the pepper without cutting all the way through.
Carefully bend the cut petals outward and downward to reveal the center and seeds.

instructions.original_text: For the leaves: wash scallions, open them without cutting through, slice into long thin strips so they curl, and arrange the flower and leaves decoratively.
decomposition: Wash the scallions thoroughly.
Lay a scallion flat and slice only the top layer lengthwise without cutting through the bottom.
Open the scallion to make it flat.
Slice the opened scallion into long thin strips on the longest side.
Allow scallion strips to curl naturally or gently encourage curling.
Arrange the pepper petals and scallion strips as a decorative flower and leaves on the plated tofu.
Serve the BBQ tofu warm.
Enjoy.
